content.body: The supreme judge by which all controversies of religion are to be determined, and all decrees of councils, opinions of ancient writers, doctrines of men, and private spirits, are to be examined, and in whose sentence we are to rest, can be no other but the Holy Spirit speaking in the Scripture.
content.name: Confession of Faith
content.title: Chapter 1: Of the Holy Scripture

content_with_prooftexts.body: The supreme judge by which all controversies of religion are to be determined, and all decrees of councils, opinions of ancient writers, doctrines of men, and private spirits, are to be examined, and in whose sentence we are to rest, can be no other but the Holy Spirit speaking in the Scripture.1
content_with_prooftexts.name: Confession of Faith

prooftexts.1:
Matthew 22:29

But Jesus answered them, “You are wrong, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God.

Matthew 22:31

And as for the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was said to you by God:

Ephesians 2:20

built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone,

Acts 28:25

And disagreeing among themselves, they departed after Paul had made one statement: “The Holy Spirit was right in saying to your fathers through Isaiah the prophet: (ESV)

content_with_prooftexts.title: Chapter 1: Of the Holy Scripture

feed:
Confession of Faith
Chapter 1: Of the Holy Scripture

10. The supreme judge by which all controversies of religion are to be determined, and all decrees of councils, opinions of ancient writers, doctrines of men, and private spirits, are to be examined, and in whose sentence we are to rest, can be no other but the Holy Spirit speaking in the Scripture.1

  1. Matthew 22:29

    But Jesus answered them, “You are wrong, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God.

    Matthew 22:31

    And as for the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was said to you by God:

    Ephesians 2:20

    built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone,

    Acts 28:25

    And disagreeing among themselves, they departed after Paul had made one statement: “The Holy Spirit was right in saying to your fathers through Isaiah the prophet: (ESV)
title: Of the holy Scripture, part 10
